ca.mcgill.ecse211.final_project_beta1.finalproject

Class FinalProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.final_project_beta1.finalproject.FinalProject

  • public class FinalProject
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the robot to localize at the stating corner, travel through the tunnel, search for cans, determine the weight and color of the can, and bring it back to the stating corner.
    Author:
    Xiangyun Wang

      • travel_SZLL

        public static void travel_SZLL(int LLx,
                               int LLy)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method makes the robot travel to the lower left corner of the search zone, then it relocalizes itself.
        Parameters:
        LLx - X component of the lower left corner
        LLy - Y component of the lower left corner
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • travel_TN

        public static void travel_TN(int TN_LLx,
                             int TN_LLy,
                             int TN_URx,
                             int TN_URy)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method tells the robot in which direction the tunnel is (following the x axis or y axis) and then it computes the location of the middle of the tile that is located before the entrance of the tunnel so that the robot can travel to it after the localization. It will call the relocalize() method described further, then travels through the tunnel.
        Parameters:
        TNR_LLx - Lower left x of tunnel
        TNR_LLy - Lower left y of tunnel
        TNR_URx - Upper right x of tunnel
        TNR_URy - Upper right y of tunnel
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • relocalize

        static void relocalize(java.lang.Boolean direction)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        The following method is divided in three parts: First compare the intensity of the floor and the intensity of what the light sensor is scanning. If the difference between the color of the floor and what the light sensor is currently measuring is smaller than 100 then both readings are on the floor. If the difference is more than 100, the light sensor is on a black line. Second, we check the values of the light sensor while the robot is going backwards: if one of the two light sensors detects a black line, we make the wheel on its side stop. the robot keeps turning backwards until the remaining light sensor also detects a black line. This allows the robot to correct its angle and its position relatively to the chosen axis. Thirdly, the same process is repeated after the robot turns to the direction along the other axis. For example, if the tunnel is on the X axis, it starts by localizing according to the Y axis, then the X axis. If the tunnel is on the Y axis, it localizes first according to the X axis, then according to the Y axis.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction of the tunnel
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • relocalize_cross

        static void relocalize_cross(double x,
                             double y)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method is very similar to the relocalize() method, except that we call it when we are on an intersection (lines crossing)
        Parameters:
        x - X component of the intersection
        y - Y component of the intersection
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • search_can

        public static void search_can(UltrasonicPoller myData)
                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method allows the robot to travel to the lower left corner of the searching zone then makes it turn 60 degrees to face the search zone and still cover its edge when it starts scanning. The robot reads the distances from the cans detected and records the smallest one and the position it was at when it read it. After scanning the area, it goes back to the position recorded and travels to the closest can. Through the half of the distance, scan the area again to make sure that the robot is going in the right direction.
        Parameters:
        myData - data from ultrasonic sensor
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • grab_can

        public static void grab_can()
        When the robot is in front of the can, since the claws are at the back, it follows this procedure: the robot goes backwards, rotates 180 degrees, lower the claws so that they are at the same level as the can and opens. After finding the correct values, add the values as variables at top of code to generate parameters

      • release_can

        public static void release_can()
        This method brings the can back on the table by rotating the claw motor.

      • weight

        public static boolean weight()
        This method allows the robot the can to be weighted: Before getting the tacho count and the time, we set the claw motors to float. To figure out if the can is light or heavy, we record the amount of time t1 when the tacho count is 0, then records t2, the time it takes for the motor to reach a tacho count of 50 degrees. Then it calculates the difference and if it is smaller than 300ms, it is a heavy can if it is bigger than 300ms, it is light can.
        Returns:
        true for heavy, false for light

      • getLightData

        public static int[] getLightData()
        This method gets the intensity measured by the two light sensors we record these values in an array with the slot 0 for the left light sensor and 1 for the right light sensor.
        Returns:
        light intensity array

      • detect_color

        public static void detect_color(ColorSensor myData)
        This method is used to detect the color of the can and update it to the detected_color Each time a sample scan is taken a color is assigned to it. The color array is used to keep track of the number of occurrences of a color The color that occurred the most times, thus the color having the highest value in the array, is the color printed to the LCD string
        Parameters:
        myData - This is the light sensor data provider

      • correct_angle

        public static double correct_angle(double angle)
        The following method allows the robot to turn to the minimum angle, thus if the angle is bigger than 360, we subtract 360 from the current angle. If it is smaller than 0, we add 360.
        Parameters:
        angle - input angle
        Returns:
        angle corrected angle

      • advanced_beep

        public static void advanced_beep(int times)
        This method contains a for loop and a times variables. the robot will beep the number of times taken in argument by advanced_beep
        Parameters:
        times - Number of times we want the robot to beep.
